title: Re-distributor of commander keen
content:
if i ever get the new dos vault site online with the server
i might plan on opening a online shop where you can purchase & download legal dos games such as commander keen

so where do i start?

title: hum...
content: I'm not sure on the particulars, but I'm confident that acquiring the rights to distribute games is going to be much more expensive than you anticipate.  :-)

title: Re: hum...
content:
Go ahead, that'd be cool! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] And yeah, it may be quite expensive.

Edit: And where to start? I'm sorry, I have no idea. Perhaps e-mailing Tom..?Eat your veggies!

title: TomTomTOM!!!
content:
Boy... Tom must be just dying in all the mail we're sending him:

- SGA Numbers
- Keen Chronicals
- Keen's rights (though, if he knew people, he'd also have Keen's rights)
- Invite to PCKF
- More I just don't recall at the moment

Grandy: "Tom!!!"
Malvaneous: "Tom!!!"
KR: "TOM!!!"
Rest of PCKF community *In individual emails*: "Err... Tom!!!"

Tom: "Gaah!!! They're alive!!! ID Bring back Keen before I die!!!"

Head of ID *Secret meeting*: "Okay... in order to keep up our good reputation to the public; we got to release TUIT!!!"

ID techi: "That's impossible; we can't release anything that soon!!!"

ID Head; "Well, take our secret Duke Nuken project, and put keen in it."

Keen Fans: "Boy... I never knew Keen defeated Dr. Proton in Episode 1. What we learn..."

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: TomTomTOM!!!
content:
I don't think anybody ever actually e-mailed him about SGA numbers.

Of course he does know people, but that has nothing to do with having the rights to Keen, which he doesn't.
Still, Tom doesn't know better who to contact than the person you'd get on the phone/e-mail if you'd go through proper channels, I suspect he'll know less considering he works for a wholly different company.
I really believe asking Tom for this favour is not the right way to go.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Email?
content:
Well... I called president Bush, but the phone was answered by some phony who told me he wasn't to be disturbed...
Then, after some more calling (To Brett Farve, Mike Sherman, and Governor Doyle [Quarter Back of Green Bay Packer {He wears keen's helmet} Caoch of GB Packers, and Govenor of WI]), but they all hung up when they found that I was inquiring about the rights of a 15 year old DOS game. /joke

Basically; Tom would be our only option. I was only joking, but sortta proved a point as well. We need to get one of our forum members to join ID software. I'd have to say, if anybody, adurdin or Xtraverse would be our best picks (They are the most skilled in coding, and the sort); they'd make great contacts [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] .

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Email?
content: [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Haven't heard of that idea yet! Brilliant! Why haven't I realized that yet?! Yes, we need to get someone to join iD, someone skilled that would be noticed and get higher there, and finally own the company and give Tom Hall the rights. Although adurdin or xtra are skilled, they're probably not skilled enough for what iD might want. :\Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Tom Hall!!!
content: I'd say Commander Keen has established more of a 'cult' status rather than a phenomenon. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: true, but...
content:
I'm sure on one hand, in some way, Tom is deeply touched that people would fall in love with a character who he created to be, in essence, himself at 9 years of age. That's to be expected...

But on the other hand, in a different way, Tom may be genuinely bothered or mildly annoyed that we put his character in certain situations he may or may not be comfortable with.

And on a third hand, the quality of the posts on the forum itself don't exactly make it the most welcoming place for newcomers. We've got a lot of "lol" responses with tons of emotikeens and general chaos going around. :-)

The truth is, if Tom ever did actually post something on these boards, whatever he posted would be almost ignored in the sea of questions the board would flood him with. There ought to be an FAQ covering the things he's already been asked, so if he ever DOES show up, we don't botch an opportunity by repeating the same old, same old!

After all, he is the final authority on Commander Keen. It's his character![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: true, but...
content:
Oh I dunno, he seems a nice enough guy when I spoke to him, I'm pretty sure he'd tolerate a bit of crap from us. Not too much mind.

But a FAQ would be good.

title: Re: :offended
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Fleex wrote a FAQ some time ago. Maybe someone saved it?[hr][/quote]

13.) How can Keen breath on Mars? Why is the gravity 'normal'? Why can Keen jump so much higher than any normal person?

Because you are taking a computer game way to seriously. Go and join a role playing game freak.

27.) Are the Gargs meant to charge at you like that?

Don't breed.

34.) Why the hell should I play this crappy decade old game anyways?

You shouldn't. First, uninstall Keen, making sure all files are completely deleted, even from your recycle bin. Next put the diskettes and manual back in the box, just like they were when you got them. Then, mail them to a Keener who'll actually enjoy the game. Tell them you're to freakin stupid to enjoy Keen.




A proud member of the signature stealing society

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: SEP
content:
1) His Simplified Employee Pension? Don't you mean something like SCBA?

2) It seems the cities on Mars have some artificial extra gravity, because Keen still falls with a speed that seems normal-ish, so that point isn't valid. Also for instance Gnosticus IV seems Earth-like enough, but Keen can still jump very high there.Retodon8
